TextBody:
Hello Philipp,
 
Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support.  I'm Rej and I'll be supporting you today.
 
To help us streamline the troubleshooting process and resolve your issue more efficiently, please provide the following information:   
 
- What steps to troubleshoot the issue have already been taken?  
- What are the steps to reproduce?  

To assist you more effectively, we kindly ask for the following information: 

	For a scan issue: Please provide the log files generated during the scan. 



	For a WebApp issue: We’ll need screenshots of the full error message, along with any related event log errors. 


Place these files into an archive and upload it via customer portal in 'My Tickets' section: https://www.netwrix.com/tickets.html 

Once we receive these details, we’ll be able to analyze the situation further and provide a more accurate resolution. 

Looking forward to your response. 


Thank you,

Rej Uddin

Technical Support Team Lead

Phone: 1-949-407-5125 | Toll-free: 888-638-9749

____________________ __________

Powerful Data Security Made Easy

6160 warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
www.netwrix.com
Netwrix | Cybersecurity that works for you.
Easily identify sensitive, regulated and mission-critical information in your data stores and focus on the information that truly requires protection.

TextBody:
Hello Philipp,
 

Before we schedule a call, could you please confirm which authentication method you are using?


	Windows Authentication: Claims function properly with the latest version.
	SAML Authentication: Claims are currently not supported.


For role claims, please be aware that PingCastle might utilize the same role claims for its internal roles, which could lead to potential issues.

Concerning the scheduler, specific configurations are required to display the domain correctly. Please create a task schedule and modify the command line option to include a wildcard. For example, use --server *.example.com instead of --server .example.com. No other parameters should be altered or modified. This task must be located within the PingCastle task scheduler folder.

Hope this helps.

Thank you,

Rej Uddin

Technical Support Team Lead

Phone: 1-949-407-5125 | Toll-free: 888-638-9749

On Role Claims: i made specifically sure that Role Names are not overlapping with internal Names.
On the scheduler: Please re-read my Issue with the scheduler. Your Response is not related to the Display Issue i´m describing.
Please schedule the meeting.
Thank you,
Philipp

Hi Rej,

On Role Claims: i made specifically sure that Role Names are not overlapping with internal Names.

Von: Netwrix Support
Gesendet: Donnerstag, 03. April 2025 11:46
Bis: Buchwald, Philipp [ABMDE]
Cc: kevin.croucher@netwrix.com
Betreff: [EXTERNAL] RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #440816 - - AW: Azure Claims not working as expected [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0NdfZ7:ref ]

 

Hello Philipp,
 

Before we schedule a call, could you please confirm which authentication method you are using?


	Windows Authentication: Claims function properly with the latest version.
	SAML Authentication: Claims are currently not supported.


For role claims, please be aware that PingCastle might utilize the same role claims for its internal roles, which could lead to potential issues.

Concerning the scheduler, specific configurations are required to display the domain correctly. Please create a task schedule and modify the command line option to include a wildcard. For example, use --server *.example.com instead of --server .example.com. No other parameters should be altered or modified. This task must be located within the PingCastle task scheduler folder.

Hope this helps.

Thank you,

Rej Uddin

Technical Support Team Lead

Phone: 1-949-407-5125 | Toll-free: 888-638-9749

ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0NdfZ7:ref
Subject: RE: AW: AW: Netwrix Support Ticket #440816 - - AW: Azure Claims not working as expected    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0NdfZ7:ref ]

TextBody:
Hello Philipp,

Thank you for taking the time to meet today.

Today we:
- Claims and Domains via SSO: We investigated the issues with viewing Claims and Domains using a test user via SSO. Various methods were tested, including changing the username to an email address.
- Task Scheduler: Problems with the Task Scheduler were identified. The command was modified from --server domain.local to -server *, which resolved the issue.
- Scanning and Reporting: It was noted that failed scans are only visible in the logs. A suggestion was made to improve the reporting page visuals to clearly indicate "Scan failed (check logs)."

I have raised an escalation to R&D for this ticket. Escalation ticket no: 0040964

At this time, we do not have a specific timeline for the resolutions. We are actively working on addressing the issues and will keep you updated as and when we can.


Thank you,

Rej Uddin

Technical Support Team Lead

Phone: 1-949-407-5125 | Toll-free: 888-638-9749
